Sileidy Francciny Batista da Silveira 

Esta dissertayao analisa o mercado de distribuivao de derivados de petroleo no Brasil 
considerando sua evolugao historica e seus determinantes no contexto marcado pela 
desregulamenta.;:ao oconida no inicio desta decada, buscando identificar pontos relevantes de 
uma estrategia competitiva para as grandes empresas participantes nesse mercado. 

Para embasar a analise e apresentada a evoluvao historica da industria petro!ifera mundial e 
brasileira, destacando a atuayiio dos principais agentes economicos e seus reflexos na 
estrutura do rnercado. A seguir sao expostas as principais caracteristicas dessa industria e as 
etapas do processo produtivo - exploragao, produ<;:ao, transporte, refino e distribuigao - corn 
enfase na etapa de distribuiyaO de derivados de petroleo. 

Essa etapa e analisada atraves da apresentayao de: a) seu desenvolvimento historico e as 
transformav5es oconidas ap6s a desregulamentavao do setor efetuada pelo govemo brasileiro 
no inicio dos anos 90; b) formavao e dinamica do rnercado consumidor de combustiveis 
derivados de petroleo; c) evolucao da participayao de mercado das cornpanhias distribuidoras. 

Finaliza-se a analise com a exposivao das principais fon;as competitivas que agern neste 
mercado e do desernpenho economico-financeiro de suas principais empresas - BR, Shell, 
Ipiranga e Texaco - no periodo de 92 a 96, apontando para as vantagens competitivas que as 
empresas devern desenvolver para se manterem de forma duradoura no mercado apesar da 
acirrada concorrencia que tern sido verificada nesta decada.

ABSTRACT 

MASTER OF SCIENCE DISSERTATION 

Sileidy Francciny Batista da Silveira 

This dissertation analyzes the distribution market of oil products in Brazil, considering its 
historical evolution and its determinants in the context marked by the deregulation ocurred at 
the beginning of this decade, seeking to identify relevant points of a competitive strategy for 
the large participating companies on this market. 

To support this analysis it is presented the historical evolution of the brazilian and world oil 
industry, emphasizing the action of the main economic agents and its effects on the market 
structure. It's also exposed the characteristics of this industry and the steps of the productive 
process - exploration, production, transportation, refining and distribution - with emphasis on 
the oil product distribution. 

This step is analyzed through the presentation of a) its historical development and the 
transformations ocurred after the deregulation of the sector done by the brazilian government 
in the early 90's; b) the formation and dynamics of the oil products consumer market; c) the 
evolution of the distribution companies market share. 

The analysis ends vrith an exposition of the main competitive forces that act on this market 
and the economic and financial performance of its main companies - BR, Shell, Ipiranga and 
Texaco - in the 92 throug 96 period, pointing out the competitive advantages that the 
companies should develop in order to maintain themselves on the market in a long-lasting 
way, despite the tough competition of the 90's.
